result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Decarus M Fluker

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Decarus M Fluker not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Decarus M Fluker.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Parties request another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Decarus M Fluker not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Decarus M Fluker.  Prosecuting attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date. Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Decarus M Fluker appeared by video, in custody in MSDF.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Decarus M Fluker.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #13CF4475. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective C. Slecker. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Decarus M Fluker in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Defendant Decarus M Fluker in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present due to vacation. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Decarus M Fluker not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Cerniglia in trial this week. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Decarus M Fluker in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Decarus M Fluker in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness was present. Court adjourn due to court conjecture. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Michael Cerniglia
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Decarus M Fluker in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Decarus M Fluker in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Decarus M Fluker appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
